variant.note: Iran has often been referred to as Persia since ancient Greek times, the name deriving from Greek records and histories. In 1935, the Shah requested that foreign nations refer to the nation and its citizens as Iran and Iranians, the Persian (Farsi) language terms. Since that time, Iran/Iranians have generally been accepted as the correct nomenclature for the modern nation while Persia/Persian are used to refer to the empires and cultures of antiquity.
Official name of the state ruled by the Qajar Dynasty.
Official name of nation adopted by Pahlavi Dynasty.
Government formed following abdication and exile of the Shah. The government resigned on November 6 prior to the effective date of a new constitution in protest of the Iranian hostage crisis.
